items.name: Scythe of the Last Shepherd

quote.text: A shepherd of souls needs no flock - only the fallen.
quote.author: Veshtal, Final Harvester of the Weeping Fields

items.requirements: Requires Attunement by a creature who has personally slain a sentient being
items.description: Forged in the hollow of a forgotten grave-moon, the Scythe of the Last Shepherd is a curved, obsidian-bladed weapon bound in soulsteel and wrapped in funerary linen. It is unnaturally cold, and shadows cling to it even in daylight. Upon felling a creature, the scythe may claim its very soul.

abilities.name: Soulbound Edge
abilities.description: This magic weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack rolls. It deals magical slashing damage, and you may choose for the damage to be necrotic instead.

abilities.name: Soulharvest
abilities.description: When you reduce a creature of CR 1 or higher to 0 hit points with this weapon, you may choose to harvest its soul. You can store a maximum number of souls equal to your proficiency bonus. Harvested souls remain until used.

abilities.name: Expend Soul
abilities.description:
When you hit with this weapon, you may expend one stored soul to apply one of the following effects: Deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage. Gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Give the target disadvantage on its next saving throw before the end of your next turn.
You may apply only one effect per hit.

items.imageAlt: An ornate brass lantern containing an eternal magical flame, glowing with shifting colors
items.name: Lantern of Five Graces

quote.text: Mercy is not a light we carry — it is a light that carries us.
quote.author: Inscribed on the lantern's base in Celestial

items.requirements: Requires Attunement by a creature capable of casting at least one spell that restores hit points
items.description: This elegant lantern is fashioned from polished brass and veined crystal, suspended by a leather loop at the hip. Within its glass core burns a gentle, ever-changing flame that pulses with radiant hues. Each time the bearer casts a healing spell, the flame subtly shifts, and the lantern bestows a unique boon upon the healed creature. These effects rotate in a fixed sequence, making the lantern a tool not just of restoration, but of strategy, foresight, and divine rhythm.

abilities.name: Rotating Boons
abilities.description: Each time you restore hit points to a creature using a spell of 1st level or higher, the flame shifts to the next effect in its cycle. The following boon applies only to the creature that was just healed. The effects cycle in this fixed order:

abilities.name: 1. Voice of the Resurgent
abilities.description: The healed creature may immediately cast a cantrip as a reaction.

abilities.name: 2. Radiant Return
abilities.description: The healed creature's next weapon attack before the end of their next turn deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage. They regain hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt, up to 6 HP.

abilities.name: 3. Recall the Flame
abilities.description: If the healed creature is a spellcaster and has expended a 1st-level spell slot, they regain one such slot.

abilities.name: 4. Surge of Motion
abilities.description: The healed creature may immediately move up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. If they end this movement adjacent to a hostile creature, they may make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

abilities.name: 5. Concussive Blessing
abilities.description: The healed creature may use an action on their next turn to release a force wave in a 15-foot cube originating from themselves. The wave deals no damage, but all creatures in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away and emit a faint glow. The next attack made against a glowing creature before the end of your next turn has advantage.

items.imageAlt: Bronze metal helmet with small chimes hanging from the bottom
items.name: Helm of Hollow Echoes

quote.text: Every lie leaves an echo. The helm merely knows how to listen.
quote.author: Scribed into the inner rim in Infernal

items.description: Forged from darkened bronze and lined with silent chimes that never ring, the Helm of Hollow Echoes hums faintly in the presence of deceit. It does not shout the truth — it listens, and waits.

abilities.name: Hollow Chime
abilities.description: While wearing the helm, if a creature within 5 feet knowingly speaks a lie, the helm emits a soft, echoing chime only you can hear. Once this chime is triggered, it cannot occur again for 10 minutes.

abilities.name: Seek the Lie
abilities.description: Once per long rest, you may activate the helm and focus on a specific lie you've heard — for example, 'It wasnt me!' For the next minute, the helm pulls faint auditory echoes from your surroundings, guiding you toward a location where that exact phrase (or something nearly identical) was spoken. The results and clarity are determined by the DM, and may offer atmospheric cues, emotional impressions, or vague directional guidance.

items.name: The Echoblade

quote.text: It's not the first cut that kills you. It's the one that echoes.
quote.author: Unknown swordsman, last recorded words

items.requirements: Requires Attunement by a creature that has spoken at least one lie in the last 24 hours
items.description: Forged in a forgotten hall where sound never dies, the Echoblade hums faintly with whispers of the past. Every swing seems to carry a delay — not in movement, but in consequence. The sword reacts not just to the moment of impact, but to the memory of it.

abilities.name: Echo Strike
abilities.description: When you hit a creature with this sword, a delayed phantom slash echoes the attack at the start of your next turn, dealing an additional 1d6 force damage to the same target (or the space they last occupied, if they moved).

abilities.name: Truth Has No Power Here
abilities.description: While attuned, you have advantage on Deception checks. However, you cannot speak the absolute truth three times in a row — the blade lightly shocks you (1 psychic damage) if you do.

abilities.name: Whispers of the Wielder
abilities.description: Once per day, you can ask the blade a yes/no question aloud. It answers in your own voice, but with an ominous echo. The blade is not bound to truth or accuracy.
